tool_input.content:
--- theme: ../ layout: default clicks: 7 ---

How Skills Work

Agent Skill Reference →

Step 1: Create a SKILL.md file

# pdf-processing/SKILL.md
---
name: pdf-processing
description: Extract text and tables
from PDF files, fill forms, merge docs.
---
That's it for the minimum spec:
  • name - identifier (lowercase, hyphens)
  • description - what it does & when to use

Step 2: Add instructions

# pdf-processing/SKILL.md
---
name: pdf-processing
description: Extract text and tables...
---
# PDF Processing
## When to use this skill
Use when the user needs to work with PDFs...
## How to extract text
1. Use pdfplumber for extraction...
## How to fill forms
Run scripts/fill_form.py...
The markdown body contains:
  • Step-by-step instructions
  • Examples of inputs/outputs
  • References to scripts & files
  • Common edge cases
Keep under 500 lines - move details to references/

Step 3: Add supporting files

pdf-processing/
├── SKILL.md
├── scripts/
├── extract.py
└── fill_form.py
├── references/
├── FORMS.md
└── advanced-extraction.md
└── assets/
└── form-template.pdf
Optional directories:
  • scripts/ - executable code
  • references/ - detailed docs
  • assets/ - templates, data files
In SKILL.md, link to these: "See references/FORMS.md"

What the agent sees at startup

<!-- In the system prompt -->
<available_skills>
<skill>
<name>pdf-processing</name>
<description>Extract text and
tables from PDFs...</description>
<location>.claude/skills/
pdf-processing/SKILL.md</location>
</skill>
<!-- more skills... -->
</available_skills>
Progressive disclosure:
  • ~100 tokens per skill at startup
  • Only name + description loaded
  • Full instructions loaded on demand
Agent knows what skills exist without loading everything

Worked Example: "Process this PDF"

User Input
"Extract the tables from invoice.pdf"
Agent Thinks
"I have a pdf-processing skill..."
Action
Reads SKILL.md
> Read .claude/skills/pdf-processing/SKILL.md

Worked Example: "Process this PDF"

Agent Reads
SKILL.md instructions
Agent Finds
"See references/advanced-extraction.md for table extraction"
Action
Reads reference file
> Read .claude/skills/pdf-processing/references/advanced-extraction.md

Worked Example: "Process this PDF"

Agent Learns
"Use scripts/extract.py"
Action
Runs the script
Result
Tables extracted exactly as you designed
> Bash python .claude/skills/pdf-processing/scripts/extract.py invoice.pdf
